Utterance: Hi again! It’s nice to see you. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I actually applied for that job we talked about!
That’s fantastic news! How did it feel to submit the application?
It was nerve-wracking, but I felt proud of myself for doing it. I was really anxious leading up to it, though.
It’s completely normal to feel anxious. What helped you push through that anxiety?
I kept reminding myself of the affirmation we talked about. It really helped me focus.
That’s wonderful! Using affirmations can be a powerful tool. Have you heard back from the job yet?
Not yet. I’m trying not to dwell on it too much, but it’s hard.
It is hard to wait. How are you managing those feelings of uncertainty?
I’ve been distracting myself with more horror movies and music. It helps take my mind off things.
That’s a good strategy. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since applying?
I think I feel a bit more hopeful, but I also have moments of doubt.
It’s great that you’re feeling hopeful! Doubt can creep in, especially during times of uncertainty. What do you do when those doubts arise?
I try to remind myself that I took a step forward. It’s just hard to silence that voice that says I’m not good enough.
That inner critic can be persistent. Have you thought about how you could counter that voice with self-compassion?
I’ve been trying to do that. I’ll tell myself that it’s okay to feel this way and that I’m doing my best.
That’s a great approach. Remember, it’s all part of the process. What else have you been doing to take care of yourself during this time?
I’ve been going for walks in the park. It helps clear my head.
That sounds wonderful! Nature can be very grounding. How do you feel during and after your walks?
I feel more relaxed and less anxious afterward. It’s nice to get some fresh air.
That’s excellent to hear. Is there a particular route or spot in the park that you enjoy?
There’s this little pond with ducks that I love. It’s peaceful there.
That sounds lovely. Spending time in peaceful environments can really help with anxiety. Have you thought about incorporating more time there into your routine?
I’d like to! Maybe I can make it a weekly thing to go and sit by the pond.
That’s a great idea! Setting aside time for yourself can be very beneficial. How do you feel about making that a goal for this week?
I think I can do that. It sounds nice.
Wonderful! Let’s also check in on the job application. If you don’t hear back, remember that it doesn’t reflect your worth.
I’ll keep that in mind. I’m trying to focus on the positives.
That’s a healthy mindset. What are some positives you can focus on right now?
Well, I applied for a job, I’m taking care of myself, and I’ve been enjoying my walks.
Those are all significant positives! Celebrating those small victories can help build momentum. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I think I’m good for now. I feel like I’ve made some progress.
You absolutely have! I’m proud of you for taking those steps. Let’s continue to build on this momentum in our next session.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next time.
Bye!
